ISO 15118-3.description:
ISO 15118-3 is a part of the ISO 15118 series, which specifies standards for vehicle-to-grid communication interfaces, ensuring interoperability between different manufacturers. Published in 2015, ISO 15118-3 focuses on the physical and data link layer requirements essential for secure and efficient communication between electric vehicles (EVs) and charging stations (EVSE). This standard encompasses various aspects including the setup of logical networks, EMC requirements, performance times, timeouts, calibration of power levels, and charging profiles pertinent to EVCC (Electric Vehicle Communication Controller) and SECC (Supply Equipment Communication Controller) systems.

ISO 15118-3 defines the procedures and protocols needed for these layers to support high-level communication across the EVSE and EVs, facilitating a standardized approach to conductive charging systems for electric vehicles. This part of the ISO 15118 standard also ensures that the communication interface between EVs and charging stations (V2G) is reliable, covering message exchanges and other relevant communication protocols.

ISO 15118-3:2015.description:
ISO 15118-3:2015 is an international standard published by ISO, which outlines detailed procedures and requirements for the communication interfaces between electric vehicles (EVs) and their charging infrastructure. Specifically, this standard is part of the larger ISO 15118 series that addresses electric vehicle conductive charging systems. ISO 15118-3:2015 focuses on the physical and data link layers of the communication protocols required for vehicle-to-grid (V2G) interactions and the communication between EVs and electric vehicle supply equipment (EVSE).

This document provides comprehensive guidelines and conformance testing requirements for various technologies, including Power Line Communication (PLC) networks such as G3-PLC and HomePlug Green PHY communication modules. It also includes protocols for calibration and measurement of power levels for PLC signals, as referenced in ISO 15118-5:2018(E). ISO 15118-3:2015 ensures the proper implementation, performance times, and energy-saving mechanisms in the communication systems of EV charging, making it a critical reference for the development and validation of V2G communication interfaces.

In essence, ISO 15118-3:2015 is crucial for defining the standards necessary for seamless and efficient communication between electric vehicles and the electrical grid, as well as the technical specifications required for a robust and interoperable EV charging ecosystem.

MAC ADDRESS.description: "MAC Address is a unique identifier assigned to network interfaces for communication on the data link layer."<SEP>"MAC Address, or Media Access Control Address, is a unique identifier assigned to network interfaces for communications."<SEP>"MAC address is a unique identifier assigned to network interfaces, used in the context of amplitude map exchanges described."<SEP>"MAC address is used to identify devices in the SLAC process, including the EV and EV Host."<SEP>"MAC address refers to a unique identifier assigned to the network interfaces of the PEV and EVSE for communication purposes."<SEP>"MAC Address represents a unique identifier for network interfaces involved in the validation communication."

SIGNAL LEVEL ATTENUATION CHARACTERIZATIO.description: "SLAC is a protocol to measure the signal strength between HomePlug Green PHY stations."<SEP>"Signal Level Attenuation Characterization (SLAC) refers to the process of assessing and measuring the reduction in signal strength, particularly in communication systems."

VEHICLE-TO-GRID (V2G).description: "Vehicle-to-Grid (V2G) is a concept that allows electric vehicles to communicate with the power grid to exchange data and optimize energy usage."

QUADRATURE PHASE SHIFT KEYING (QPSK).description: "Quadrature Phase Shift Keying (QPSK) is a modulation technique used in communication systems for effectively transmitting data by manipulating the phase of the carrier signal."<SEP>"Quadrature Phase Shift Keying (QPSK) is a modulation technique used in communication systems for transmitting data efficiently."

CONTROL PILOT.description: "Control Pilot is a signaling method used in electric vehicle supply equipment to control and manage the charging process."<SEP>"Control Pilot is a signaling method used to communicate the status of the charging process between the EVSE and the EV."<SEP>"Control Pilot refers to a signaling method used in electric vehicle charging infrastructure to manage communication and control between the vehicle and the charging station."<SEP>"Control Pilot refers to the communication line used in electric vehicle charging, helping with control and coordination between the EV and the EVSE."<SEP>"Control Pilot refers to the signal used in the EVSE to manage the charging process of the electric vehicle."<SEP>"The control pilot is a signaling circuit used in electric vehicle charging to indicate the status of the connection between the EV and the EVSE."

connections.description: "Control Pilot is essential in managing the charging process through EVSE as outlined in ISO 15118-3."<SEP>"EVSE uses the control pilot signal to manage communication and handle errors with the EV during the charging process."<SEP>"Each EVSE outlet has a dedicated pilot function controller to handle control pilot requirements."<SEP>"The EVSE interacts with the control pilot line to receive and respond to signals from the EV during the matching and validation processes."
"Control Pilot is a communication mechanism used in EVSE to manage and control the charging process."
"HLC-C utilizes the Control Pilot communication to regulate the charging process with advanced protocols."
"CP State X1 is a specific signal state used in control pilot operations as per ISO 15118-3."
"CP State X2 is another control signal state used in pilot signaling for EVSE."
"AC EVSE uses control pilot for managing the charging process, including timeout handling."

"EV utilizes control pilot communication to interact with EVSE, especially during error loss and recovery."<SEP>"The EV uses the control pilot line to communicate signaling information with the EVSE during the matching and validation processes."
"The validation process uses the hardwired control pilot line to confirm the signal strength measurement."

DUTY CYCLE.description: "Duty Cycle is a concept referring to the percentage of one period in which a signal or system is active, significant in the context of electric vehicle charging."<SEP>"The duty cycle refers to the proportion of time during which a system is active compared to the total time."

MAC LEVEL.description: "MAC level (Media Access Control level) refers to a sublayer in the data link layer responsible for managing protocol access to the physical network medium, mentioned in the matching process."

EVSE (ELECTRIC VEHICLE SUPPLY EQUIPMENT).description: "EVSE defines the equipment used to deliver electrical energy from an electricity source to charge electric vehicles."<SEP>"Electric Vehicle Supply Equipment is the infrastructure used to charge electric vehicles, part of the signal transmission path."<SEP>"EVSE stands for Electric Vehicle Supply Equipment, which is the charging station being tested for compatibility with electric vehicles."

SLAC.description:
SLAC, which stands for Signal Level Attenuation Characterization, is a critical protocol and process involved in the communication and validation procedures for electric vehicle (EV) charging and Vehicle-to-Grid (V2G) systems. SLAC is primarily mentioned in the context of ISO 15118-5:2018(E) and is used to characterize and assess signal attenuation in electric vehicle communication systems, ensuring proper connections and reliable communications between electric vehicles (EVs) and electric vehicle supply equipment (EVSE). 

SLAC involves various test cases, configurations, and procedures to validate communication modules and manage communication exchanges in electric vehicle charging systems. It is an integral part of the test conditions and configurations related to attenuation characterization, power line communication, matching requests, and the readiness of communication modules within EVCC (Electric Vehicle Communication Controller) systems. Additionally, SLAC refers to specific protocol and data structures defined for the physical and data link layers, playing a vital role in the standardization and validation processes for electric vehicle communication and charging infrastructure.

In summary, SLAC (Signal Level Attenuation Characterization) is a key technology and protocol used in assessing communication signal levels, managing protocol exchanges, and ensuring the effectiveness and reliability of electric vehicle charging and communication systems, as detailed in various test cases and standards.

connections.description: "EVSE utilizes SLAC technology for signal level attenuation characterization during the charging process."<SEP>"EVSE's processes involve the use of SLAC for determining the appropriate connections with EVs."<SEP>"SLAC is involved in processes concerning the EVSE technology, likely validating, matching, or managing it."<SEP>"SLAC is involved in the validation process for EVSE through various testcases."
"EV uses SLAC as part of its process in determining the suitable EVSE for connection and communication."
"The result of the SLAC process determines the EV_Discovering_Status, which indicates connection suitability."
"SLAC is a concept detailed in the ISO 15118-5 standard, specifically relating to signal level attenuation characterization."
"SLAC is a process related to combined testing indicated in the PICS descriptions for the test configurations using MTC."

connections.target: HOMEPLUG GREENPHY SPEC., RELEASE VERSION 1.1.1, JULY 4, 2013
connections.description: "The SLAC data structures and conformance tests are based on the HomePlug GreenPHY specifications."
"SLAC data structures and test case specifications are aligned with the TTCN-3 Core Language as defined in this ETSI document."
"MME_Header is part of the SLAC message structure, indicating its use in communication protocols."
"MME_Payload is part of the SLAC message structure, indicating its use in communication protocols."
"ISO publishes the standards that describe the SLAC process used in the matching procedure."
"ISO:15118-3:2015:IS details the SLAC process, describing its importance in the matching procedures."

"HAL_61851_Listener is a component or system interacting within the SLAC-related processes."<SEP>"HAL_61851_Listener is involved in the SLAC parameter testing as described in the procedures."<SEP>"HAL_61851_Listener is involved in the initialization, configuration, and shutdown steps of the SLAC testing process."
"SystemSECC is the system under which SLAC tests are executed, indicating a structural relationship."

"SLAC is an integral part of the Attenuation Characterization tests conducted in the system."<SEP>"SLAC protocol undergoes Attenuation Characterization to evaluate signal quality during testing."<SEP>"The SLAC procedure is part of the Attenuation Characterization process in evaluating EVCC systems."
"EVCC Tester is actively involved in conducting the SLAC validation process."
"SLAC validation process is part of the protocols described in ISO 15118-5:2018."
"SLAC testing involves the use of the HAL 61851 Listener to characterize signal level attenuation in electric vehicle communication configurations."
"SLAC is involved in managing the Post Conditions for EVCC, ensuring a proper shutdown and reset of configurations."

"PLC technology is used in conjunction with SLAC for managing communication over power lines in the documented procedures."<SEP>"SLAC and PLC are related as both are involved in the data communication process over electrical power lines, potentially in the context of electric vehicle charging."
"SLAC utilizes cc_eth_broadcast for communication within the technical protocol described."

"SECC and SLAC are collaborating in the communication and validation processes for electric vehicle charging protocols."<SEP>"The SECC is involved in the SLAC process, facilitating communication and control."
"SLAC utilizes VC_sut_mac addresses in secure communication protocols for electric vehicle charging validation."
"SLAC technology involves the use of CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ messages as part of its communication processes."
"SLAC technology involves the use of CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF messages as part of its communication processes."

"CM_MNBC_SOUND_IND is a message type used within the SLAC process to indicate sound levels."<SEP>"CM_MNBC_SOUND_IND is part of the SLAC, indicating the receipt of sound indicators during testing."<SEP>"SLAC technology involves CM_MNBC_SOUND_IND messages to coordinate sound indications."
"CM_ATTEN_PROFILE_IND is a message type used within the SLAC process to indicate attenuation profiles."<SEP>"SLAC technology involves CM_ATTEN_PROFILE_IND messages related to attenuation profiles."

"CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR.IND is a significant event in the SLAC process, indicating the start of attenuation characterization."<SEP>"SLAC technology uses CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR.IND messages to indicate the start of attenuation characteristics."
"CM_SLAC_PARM_REQ is a message type used within the SLAC process to request parameters."<SEP>"CM_SLAC_PARM_REQ is a part of the SLAC process, initiating the parameter request phase."
"CM_SLAC_PARM_CNF is a message type used within the SLAC process to confirm parameters previously requested."

"The EVCC participates in the SLAC processes, working together with SECC."
"National Tsing Hua University is involved in activities related to SLAC protocol or standard."
"SLAC involves the CM_ATTEN_CHAR_RSP message as part of its protocol operations."
"The EVCC_Tester utilizes the SLAC protocol modules during testing to manage EV communication processes."
"SLAC is a protocol referenced within the ISO 15118 standard for EV communications."

ID RECOGNITION.description: "ID Recognition is a process in the EVSE system to identify and authenticate the electric vehicle before authorizing the charge."

"ID Recognition is part of the initialization phase, used to authenticate the electric vehicle."

LOSS OF COMMUNICATION.description: "Loss of Communication refers to the situation where the communication link between the electric vehicle and supply equipment is lost and needs handling by higher layers."

HLE.description: "HLE (Higher Level Entity) is an overseeing body or system that can request resets to the unmatched state in the matching process."<SEP>"HLE is a higher layer entity involved in the communication process between the EV and EVSE, managing error requests and state transitions."<SEP>"HLE refers to Higher Layer Entity, involved in initiating the termination of a logical network link."<SEP>"HLE refers to the High-Level Entity that receives the D-LINK_READY.indication if no AMP MAP Exchange occurs."

connections.description: "EVSE receives D-LINK_ERROR.requests from HLE, indicating a loss of communication and triggering state transitions and error handling procedures."
"EV receives D-LINK_ERROR.requests from HLE and follows specific protocols for error handling and communication loss."
"HLE sends D-LINK_ERROR.requests to handle communication loss situations between the EVSE and EV."
"HLE can request resets to the state of 'Unmatched' during the matching process."

ISO 15118-3:2015(E).description: "ISO 15118-3:2015(E) is a specific standard document published by ISO in the year 2015."<SEP>"ISO 15118-3:2015(E) is a standard developed by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO) that specifies the communication protocol for electric vehicle supply equipment (EVSE) and electric vehicles (EV)."<SEP>"ISO 15118-3:2015(E) is a standard document outlining the communication protocols and error handling procedures for the interaction between electric vehicle supply equipment (EVSE) and electric vehicles (EV)"<SEP>"ISO 15118-3:2015(E) is a standard or document outlining requirements and processes for the HomePlug Green PHY technology."<SEP>"ISO 15118-3:2015(E) is a standard specifying requirements for low-layer communication modules in the electric vehicle (EV) and electric vehicle supply equipment (EVSE) context."<SEP>"ISO 15118-3:2015(E) is the document, published by ISO, detailing the standards for the matching process and communication protocols in electric vehicle systems."<SEP>"ISO 15118-3:2015(E) is the event related to the publication of the standard document describing processes for electric vehicle communication and matching."

connections.description: "National Tsing Hua University has licensed access to the ISO 15118-3:2015(E) standards document for reference and application."<SEP>"National Tsing Hua University is licensed to access and use the ISO 15118-3:2015(E) standard document."<SEP>"National Tsing Hua University is the licensee of the ISO 15118-3:2015(E) document."

"ISO 15118-3:2015(E) outlines requirements for configuring the low-layer communication module on the EVSE side."<SEP>"ISO 15118-3:2015(E) provides guidelines for the EVSE regarding communication protocols and error handling with EVs."

"ISO 15118-3:2015(E) outlines specific configurations and requirements for the low-layer communication module on the EV side."<SEP>"ISO 15118-3:2015(E) outlines the procedures EVs must follow during communication and error handling with EVSE."
"ISO 15118-3:2015(E) defines the procedures and requirements for the matching process between EV and EVSE."
"HomePlug GreenPHY is the technology outlined and specified in the ISO 15118-3:2015(E) document."
"ISO developed and published the ISO 15118-3:2015(E) standard document."<SEP>"ISO published the standard document ISO 15118-3:2015(E)."
"ISO 2015 is the organization responsible for publishing the standards document ISO 15118-3:2015(E)."
"ISO 15118-3:2015(E) falls under the International Classification for Standards category ICS 43.120."

D-LINK_READY.INDICATION.description: "D-LINK_READY.indication is a communication status indicating that the logical link between an EV and EVSE is established."<SEP>"D-LINK_READY.indication is a primitive call that indicates the success or failure of the data-link setup in the matching process."<SEP>"D-LINK_READY.indication is a primitive that informs higher layers about a change in communication link status between EV and EVSE."<SEP>"D-LINK_READY.indication is a specific communication signal indicating the establishment or loss of a data link between EVSE and EV."<SEP>"D-LINK_READY.indication is an event that occurs in the ISO communication process when the link is successfully established."<SEP>"D-LINK_READY.indication is sent to the HLE if no AMP MAP Exchange request is received within the timeout."

connections.description: "D-LINK_READY.indication is used by EVSE to inform higher layers about changes in communication link status."<SEP>"D-LINK_READY.indication signals inform the EVSE about the establishment or loss of a data link."
"During the matching process, D-LINK_READY.indication indicates the success or failure of the data-link setup."
"ISO 15118 uses D-LINK_READY.indication to signal when the logical network link between EV and EVSE is established."
"SLAC_MATCH exchange leads eventually to a D-LINK_READY.indication, representing successful link establishment."

D-LINK_ERROR.REQUEST.description: "D-LINK_ERROR.request is a primitive that requests lower layers to terminate the data link and restart the matching process."<SEP>"D-LINK_ERROR.request is a signal sent by higher layer entities (HLE) to indicate a detected loss of the data link."

connections.description: "HLE sends D-LINK_ERROR.requests to handle communication loss situations between the EVSE and EV."
"D-LINK_ERROR.request is a primitive used by EVSE to request the restart of the matching process after a data link termination."

STATE X1.description: "State X1 is a control pilot state indicating that the EVSE is in sleep mode with the oscillator off and +12V supply on."<SEP>"State X1 is a defined state of the EVSE related to the control pilot during communication processes."

connections.description: "EVSE transitions to State X1 during the control pilot process as a part of communication and error handling."<SEP>"State X1 is the state of the control pilot indicating that the EVSE is in sleep mode with specific conditions."

STATE X2.description: "State X2 is a control pilot state indicating that the EVSE is ready to charge and communicate after waking up."<SEP>"State X2 is another defined state of the EVSE related to the control pilot during communication processes."

connections.description: "EVSE transitions to State X2 during the control pilot process as a part of communication and error handling."<SEP>"State X2 is the state indicating that EVSE is ready to charge and communicate after waking up."

STATE E/F.description: "State E/F is a temporary state that the EVSE enters after detecting a communication error before transitioning back to other states."

connections.description: "EVSE transitions to State E/F temporarily during error handling before going back to other states."
"T_step_EF defines the duration the EVSE must stay in State E/F during error handling."

T_STEP_EF.description: "T_step_EF denotes the time to stay at the E/F state, as specified in Table 3."<SEP>"T_step_EF is the minimum time that the EVSE must remain in State E/F during error handling."<SEP>"T_step_EF is a parameter defining the time duration for which the SUT must maintain CP States E or F during the testing."<SEP>"T_step_EF is a specific duration or step in the testing process, related to the transition between CP State E and CP State F."

connections.description: "T_step_EF defines the duration the EVSE must stay in State E/F during error handling."
"The Test System measures durations or steps such as T_step_EF during the state transitions in the testing process."
"SUT follows T_step_EF timing requirements during the test."

TP_MATCH_LEAVE.description: "TP_match_leave is a parameter indicating the duration within which the SUT must leave the logical network after the termination of the session."<SEP>"TP_match_leave is the maximum time to leave the logical network, as specified in Table 3."<SEP>"TP_match_leave is the time parameter specifying how long an EVSE or EV should wait before leaving a logical network during error handling."<SEP>"TP_match_leave is the timer condition checked during the logical network test."

connections.description: "EVSE adheres to the TP_match_leave duration while waiting to leave a logical network during error handling."
"EV follows the TP_match_leave duration for network separation during error handling."
"SUT must leave the logical network within the TP_match_leave duration after session termination."

B1 STATE.description: "B1 state is a defined state within the EV's control pilot communication process."

connections.description: "EV transitions to B1 state according to the control pilot signalling process during error handling."

T_CONN_RESETUP.description: "T_conn_resetup is the time parameter for resetting the connection process during error handling."<SEP>"T_conn_resetup refers to the time needed to reset the matching process after a loss of communication, as specified in Table 3."

connections.description: "T_conn_resetup is the EV’s parameter for restarting the connection process during error handling."

D-LINK_PAUSE.REQUEST.description: "D-LINK_PAUSE.request is a primitive that requests lower layers to enter a power-saving mode."<SEP>"D-LINK_PAUSE.request is a signal used to initiate the transition of EV and EVSE into sleep mode."

connections.description: "D-LINK_PAUSE.request is a primitive used by EVSE to enter a power-saving mode while maintaining the link status as 'Matched'."

+12V SUPPLY.description: "+12V supply refers to the power supply that remains on to keep the pilot line active during sleep mode."

connections.description: "+12V supply keeps the pilot line alive on the EVSE side during sleep mode."

BCB-TOGGLE.description: "BCB-Toggle is a mechanism used to wake up the EV and EVSE by toggling a specific signal state."<SEP>"BCB-Toggle is a sequence involved in detecting variations and validating EV-EVSE communication."<SEP>"BCB-Toggle is a switching sequence involving changing the control pilot state to verify the matching during the validation process."<SEP>"BCB-Toggle refers to a control sequence involving toggling of a signal used to validate the connection between EV and EVSE."<SEP>"BCB-Toggle refers to a toggling process in the communication protocol between an electric vehicle (EV) and the EVSE, involving control pilot line signals."

connections.description: "BCB-Toggle is a mechanism used to wake up the EV from sleep mode when signaled by the EVSE."<SEP>"EV starts the BCB-Toggle sequence for validation purposes in accordance with the ISO 15118-3 standard."<SEP>"The EV uses the BCB-Toggle sequence to change the control pilot state during the validation process."

"BCB-Toggle involves the EVSE's process of listening to BCB-Toggle signals and determining readiness or success for validation."<SEP>"EVSE counts the BCB-Toggles sent by the EV as part of the validation process."<SEP>"The EVSE detects the BCB-Toggle sequence sent by the EV to validate the matching process."

T_CONN_RESUME.description: "T_conn_resume is the maximum time allowed for the low-layer communication module to be ready after a wake-up trigger."<SEP>"T_conn_resume is the time after the wake-up trigger until the low-layer communication module is ready for communication, as specified in Table 3."

connections.description: "T_conn_resume defines the maximum time for EVSE's low-layer communication module to be ready after wake-up."

T_CONN_MAX_COMM.description: "T_conn_max_comm is likely a timer or parameter that indicates the maximum communication duration or connection time."<SEP>"T_conn_max_comm is the maximum time allowed to detect a PLC link after a wake-up, failing which a connection reinitiation occurs."<SEP>"T_conn_max_comm is the time after plug-in until the low-layer communication module is ready for communication, as specified in Table 3."

STATE B1/B2.description: "State B1/B2 refers to control pilot states used in the process of waking up the EV or EVSE during a charge pause."

ISO STORE.description:
ISO STORE is an organization that plays a crucial role in the distribution and licensing of ISO standards and documents. As a platform, ISO Store facilitates the purchase and download of ISO documents, including the specifics of standards like ISO 15118-5:2018(E) and ISO 15118-3:2015. Users can obtain licensed access to these standards through this service.

The entity not only manages the issuance of these documents but also handles the associated orders and licensing details. For example, documentation such as ISO 15118-5:2018 can be ordered and downloaded under specific license agreements, with order information such as OP-720751 referenced in the related text.

In summary, ISO Store functions as both a vendor and a distribution point, ensuring that international standards are accessible to authorized users. It is responsible for processing orders, managing licenses, and providing a controlled distribution of standards documentation, thereby maintaining the integrity and proper use of these critical documents.

connections.description: "ISO Store facilitated the order identified by the specific number OP-720751, indicating a transactional relationship."<SEP>"ISO Store is responsible for processing the order number OP-720751 for the ISO 15118-5:2018(E) document."<SEP>"ISO Store is where the order number OP-720751 for the ISO standard was processed."<SEP>"ISO Store provided the standard document ISO 15118-5:2018(E) under order number OP-720751."<SEP>"OP-720751 is a specific order processed by the ISO Store for document licensing."<SEP>"OP-720751 is an order completed through the ISO Store for the ISO 15118-5:2018 standard."<SEP>"The order OP-720751 is associated with the download and licensing of the document from the ISO Store."<SEP>"The order number OP-720751 corresponds to the purchase of the ISO 15118-5:2018(E) standard from the ISO Store."

ISO Store and National Tsing Hua University are engaged in a transactional and commercial relationship centered around the licensing of ISO standards documents. ISO Store has provided multiple licenses to National Tsing Hua University, facilitated through Yi-Shin Chen and under specific terms and conditions. This relationship primarily involves the access and use of the ISO 15118-5:2018(E) standard, among other ISO documents. The licensing agreements grant National Tsing Hua University the ability to obtain, use, and test these standards. MATCHING PROCESS.description: "Matching Process is a procedure indicated in the text to compare and match certain data or parameters."<SEP>"Matching Process refers to the steps taken to match certain criteria as part of the validation procedure described in the text."<SEP>"Matching process refers to the process of matching parameters or messages in the described context."<SEP>"Matching process refers to the sequence of actions and validations that EV and EVSE perform for ensuring proper communication and signal matching."<SEP>"The Matching Process involves determining the correct pairing between an EV and an EVSE based on signal strength measurements."<SEP>"The Matching Process involves establishing a unique connection between an EV and a specific charge coupler of the EVSE. It includes multiple steps for validation and signal assessment."<SEP>"The matching process refers to the sequence of actions taken to establish a communication link between EV and EVSE."<SEP>"The Matching process refers to the sequence of operations and protocols followed to verify and establish successful communication and testing standards."

CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ.description:
"CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ" is a communication message type involved in the SLAC (Signal-Level Attenuation Characterization) process between Electric Vehicles (EV) and Electric Vehicle Supply Equipment (EVSE). It is primarily a request message sent by the EV to initiate parameter exchange and start the matching process necessary for signal strength measurements. This message triggers specific actions and starts a new matching process within the evaluation phase.

The message type "CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ" is defined in the ISO 15118-5:2018(E) standard and is used for requesting parameters during the SLAC process. It is a crucial part of both the technical communication protocol and the testing procedures where it indicates specific parameters and a valid runID that need to be checked by the Test System. The message is used during various test cases, and it must include valid parameters and a runID. 

The low-layer communication module on the EV side should not respond to this message, emphasizing its role as an outgoing request from the EV. Overall, "CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ" is integral to the parameter request and evaluation aspects of SLAC in the context of electric vehicle communication protocols.

connections.description: "TT_EVSE_SLAC_init triggers the matching process, which involves sending CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ messages."
"Receiving CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ influences the start of a new matching process."
"HomePlug GreenPHY requires specific message responses from modules during network communication; CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ is one such type."

"CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ and CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF are related as request and confirmation messages within the testing procedure."<SEP>"CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ initiates the parameter exchange by being sent from the EV to the EVSE, which responds with CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF."<SEP>"CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ requests parameters, and it is confirmed by sending a CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF response."<SEP>"CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ is a request message that receives a response in the form of a CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF message."<SEP>"CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ messages are followed by CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF messages as part of the confirmation process in the tests."<SEP>"The CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ message is expected to be acknowledged by a CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF message."

"CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ message contains a valid runID that must be verified by the Test System in the testing process."<SEP>"RunID is a critical component contained within the CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ message sent by the EV."<SEP>"RunID is used as an identifier for each CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ message during the communication process."
"APPLICATION_TYPE is a field in the CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ message indicating 'PEV-EVSE matching'."
"SECURITY_TYPE is a field in the CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ message indicating 'No Security'."
"In the test case TC_SECC_CMN_VTB_CmSlacParm_002, the Test System sends a CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ message."
"In the test case TC_SECC_CMN_VTB_CmSlacParm_004, the Test System waits until the TT_EVSE_SLAC_init timer expires before sending the CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ message."
"Test System sends and checks the repetition of CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ messages during the testing procedures."<SEP>"The Test System sends a CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ message with a valid runID and parameters."
"The Test System behavior based on par_SECC_waitForPlugin includes sending the CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ message."
"The Test System sends a CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ message after detecting the 5% duty cycle."
"EV is involved in the testing process where the CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ message is sent and processed."
"GoodCase procedure involves the execution and waiting for a valid CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ message with specific parameters and runID."
"SLAC Port receives and processes CM_SLAC_PARM_REQ messages as part of the protocol."

"ISO 15118-5:2018(E) encompasses procedures which include receiving CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ messages as part of the standard."<SEP>"ISO 15118-5:2018(E) outlines the role and processing of CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ messages in the technical workflow."<SEP>"ISO 15118-5:2018(E) sets the guidelines for CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ messages that initiate a new matching process."
"The EVCC_Tester receives CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ messages that are requests for SLAC parameters during the testing process."
"CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ message indicates a new matching process started through the SLAC_Port."<SEP>"SLAC_Port is involved in receiving the CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ message."
"SUT receives the CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ message which starts a new matching process."

CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR.IND.description: "CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR.IND is a specific message format used to initiate the characterization of attenuation between the Electric Vehicle (EV) and the Electric Vehicle Supply Equipment (EVSE) as part of the Service Level Agreement and Certification (SLAC) process. This message is mentioned in test cases and procedures, where it plays a crucial role in starting the attenuation characterization by triggering the TT_EVSE_match_MNBC timer when received by the EVSE. It is sent by either the EV or the Test System to measure individual attenuation values and is referenced in the attenuation characterization test sequence. Additionally, the low-layer communication module on the EV side should never respond to this message. Overall, CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR.IND is vital for the EV-EVSE communication process, ensuring proper measurement and characterization of signal strength and attenuation."

connections.description: "CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR.IND is a significant event in the SLAC process, indicating the start of attenuation characterization."<SEP>"SLAC technology uses CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR.IND messages to indicate the start of attenuation characteristics."
"Both CM_ATTEN_CHAR and CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR are messages the EV module avoids responding to during network communications requirements."
"The C_EV_start_atten_char_inds messages are a part of the CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR.IND process."
"CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR.IND is an MME involved in starting the attenuation characterization during the SLAC process."
"CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR.IND is a message received as part of the TT_EVSE_match_MNBC test sequence."<SEP>"The receipt of CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR.IND by the EVSE starts the TT_EVSE_match_MNBC timer."

"Test System sends CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR.IND messages as part of the test procedures."<SEP>"Test System sends CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR.IND messages as part of the testing procedures."<SEP>"The Test System sends CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR.IND messages as part of the attenuation characterization tests."
"GoodCase procedure includes waiting for the CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR.IND message to measure individual attenuation values."
"CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR.IND message leads to the sending of CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND message containing attenuation entries to the SUT."
"CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR.IND is a message type used in the test case TC_EVCC_CMN_VTB_AttenuationCharacterization_006."
"CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR.IND is a message type used in the test case TC_EVCC_CMN_VTB_AttenuationCharacterization_007."
"The message CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR.IND is checked in the test case TC_EVCC_CMN_VTB_AttenuationCharacterization_012."

CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF.description:
"CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF" is a type of confirmation message involved in the vehicular communication testing process, specifically referenced in the test case descriptions and documentation such as ISO 15118. This message is part of the communication protocol between the Test System and the system under test (SUT). The "CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF" message typically contains the current runID, EV MAC, and other valid parameters necessary for the testing procedures.

It is expected to be sent by the EVSE (Electric Vehicle Supply Equipment) to the EV (Electric Vehicle) during the matching process, parameter exchange sequence, and signal strength measurement. The message should be sent by the EVSE in response to receiving a "CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ" and must not be sent until the TT_match_response timer has expired during testing. The "CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF" message is crucial for confirming settings or parameters and is a format used to communicate parameters as part of the test procedures being conducted.

connections.description: "CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ and CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF are related as request and confirmation messages within the testing procedure."<SEP>"CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ initiates the parameter exchange by being sent from the EV to the EVSE, which responds with CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF."<SEP>"CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ requests parameters, and it is confirmed by sending a CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF response."<SEP>"CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ is a request message that receives a response in the form of a CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF message."<SEP>"CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ messages are followed by CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF messages as part of the confirmation process in the tests."<SEP>"The CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ message is expected to be acknowledged by a CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF message."
"CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF is a confirmation message within the parameter exchange sequence between the EV and the EVSE."
"The SUT is responsible for sending the CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF message in response to CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ."

"In test case TC_SECC_CMN_VTB_CmSlacParm_004, the Test System checks that no CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF message is sent until the TT_match_response timer has expired."<SEP>"The CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF message is expected after the TT_match_response timer expires."

RUNID.description: "RunID is a sequence of bytes that matches the identifier sent in the CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ message by the EV."<SEP>"RunID is a unique identifier used in the communication protocol to match requests and responses between PEV and EVSE."<SEP>"RunID is an identifier for a matching run, randomly chosen by the EV for each CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ message and remains constant for the related messages."<SEP>"RunID is a unique identifier associated with the execution of test cases, ensuring the traceability of specific test runs."<SEP>"RunID is a unique identifier used during the tests to track and validate each run of CM_SLAC_MATCH.REQ messages."<SEP>"RunID is a unique identifier used in test cases to distinguish different testing sessions related to the ISO 15118-5:2018 standard."<SEP>"RunID is an identifier used in the context of various testing procedures involving messages and sequences."<SEP>"RunID is likely a unique identifier for a specific execution or process instance."<SEP>"RunID refers to the identifier for the current test run used in message exchanges."<SEP>"runID is a parameter mentioned in the context of test case procedures."<SEP>"runID is a unique identifier used during the testing process to track specific test runs."<SEP>"runID is a unique identifier used in various messages and test cases to ensure correct identification and validation throughout the testing process."<SEP>"runID is a unique identifier used to track and log specific executions and iterations within the testing protocol."<SEP>"runID is an identifier used in messages during the test procedures to denote specific runs."<SEP>"runid is an identifier used in the context of SLAC parameter requests and responses."<SEP>"runid is an identifier used within message payloads for tracking specific runs or instances in the SLAC processes."

CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND.description: "CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND appears to be a type of message or notification in the SLAC process."<SEP>"CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND is a message containing attenuation entries sent by the Test System to the SUT for measuring attenuation values."<SEP>"CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND is a message format that sends the attenuation profile."<SEP>"CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND is a message sent as part of the process and includes attenuation characteristics."<SEP>"CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND is a message that contains the signal strength measurement result sent by the EVSE to the EV."<SEP>"CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND is a type of MME used in the SLAC process for indicating signal attenuation characteristics."<SEP>"CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND is part of the communication protocol between EV and EVSE for attenuation characterization."<SEP>"CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND is a message that includes attenuation entries, EV MAC, and other parameters sent during testing."<SEP>"CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND is a message that is checked for absence in certain test case procedures."<SEP>"CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND is a message type referenced in the document, involved in the attenuation characterization process."<SEP>"CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND is a message type used in testing procedures to communicate attenuation values and other parameters in compliance with ISO 15118 standards."<SEP>"CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND is a message type used in the test procedure to send attenuation profiles."<SEP>"CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND is a message type used to measure individual attenuation values."<SEP>"CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND is an event described in the text related to communication processes."<SEP>"CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND is an event related to the vehicular communication testing process."

CM_VALIDATE.CNF.description: "CM_VALIDATE.CNF is a confirmation event following the validation request, indicating whether the process has passed or failed according to the ISO 15118-5:2018(E) standard."<SEP>"CM_VALIDATE.CNF is a confirmation message indicating the outcome of the CM_VALIDATE.REQ message."<SEP>"CM_VALIDATE.CNF is a confirmation message received by the Test System during validation procedures as part of the ISO 15118-5:2018 standard."<SEP>"CM_VALIDATE.CNF is a confirmation message sent by EVSE during the validation process."<SEP>"CM_VALIDATE.CNF is a confirmation message sent by the EVSE to the EV during the validation of the matching decision."<SEP>"CM_VALIDATE.CNF is a confirmation message sent by the EVSE to the EV indicating the result of the validation process."<SEP>"Confirmation message sent as part of the validation process, containing the result of the validation."<SEP>"CM_VALIDATE.CNF is a confirmation message sent by the Test System after receiving the CM_VALIDATE.REQ message."<SEP>"CM_VALIDATE.CNF is a confirmation message type/code received after the validation process."<SEP>"CM_VALIDATE.CNF is a specified message type used in this protocol, indicating a validation confirmation."<SEP>"CM_VALIDATE.CNF is a type of confirmation message that the test system waits to receive during the validation process."<SEP>"CM_VALIDATE.CNF refers to the confirmation message sent during the validation process as described in the test cases."

connections.description: "CM_VALIDATE.CNF is a confirmation message that completes the validation request-response cycle in the validation process."

"CM_VALIDATE.REQ is sent by the EV to initiate validation, and CM_VALIDATE.CNF is the confirmation by EVSE with the validation result."<SEP>"CM_VALIDATE.REQ messages are followed by CM_VALIDATE.CNF messages as part of the validation process described in the test cases."<SEP>"CM_VALIDATE.REQ messages trigger the sending of CM_VALIDATE.CNF messages during the validation process as outlined in ISO 15118-5:2018."<SEP>"CM_VALIDATE.REQ triggers the receipt of a CM_VALIDATE.CNF message to confirm the validation process."

"EVSE responds to the CM_VALIDATE.REQ from the EV with a CM_VALIDATE.CNF message, indicating the result of the validation."<SEP>"EVSE sends CM_VALIDATE.CNF messages as part of the validation process."<SEP>"The EVSE sends CM_VALIDATE.CNF as part of confirming the validation request from the EV."
"The Ethernet Destination MAC address field is used in the CM_VALIDATE.CNF message to specify the communication target."
"EV receives CM_VALIDATE.CNF messages from EVSE as confirmation during the validation process."<SEP>"The EV waits for the CM_VALIDATE.CNF during the validation process."
"The TT_match_response timer is relevant to the time window for receiving the CM_VALIDATE.CNF."

"Test System waits for and checks the CM_VALIDATE.CNF messages as part of the validation process according to ISO 15118-5:2018."<SEP>"The CM_VALIDATE.CNF message is the confirmation sent by the Test System after receiving the CM_VALIDATE.REQ."
"TC_SECC_CMN_VTB_CmValidate_008 waits for CM_VALIDATE.CNF messages during its validation procedure."
"The EVCC_Tester plays a crucial role in confirming the CM_VALIDATE.CNF events during the validation process as described in the standard."
"SUT sends the CM_VALIDATE.CNF message as a confirmation after validation."

TT_MATCH_RESPONSE.description: "A testing event in the document where a timeout indicates a failure in the matching process."<SEP>"TT_match_response is a named timeout event used in test sequences involving message matching protocols."<SEP>"TT_match_response is a time-bound testing event crucial to initiating and processing matching responses."<SEP>"TT_match_response is a timer mechanism used during the SECC test procedures to track response times."<SEP>"TT_match_response is a timer or response mechanism used during the SLAC communication process."<SEP>"TT_match_response is a timer used in the test validation process to evaluate response matching during the communication validation."<SEP>"TT_match_response is a timing or sequence component used to handle responses in the communication message exchange process."<SEP>"TT_match_response is an event or function that triggers a series of actions related to matching and validation processes."<SEP>"TT_match_response is an event or procedure phase mentioned in the document, particularly related to timing out during tests."<SEP>"TT_match_response is an event related to the timing and expectations of the communication protocol tests."<SEP>"TT_match_response is the event describing the expiration of the timing for the CM_SLAC_MATCH matching response."<SEP>"TT_match_response refers to a timeout event during the testing of the Matching process."<SEP>"TT_match_response refers to the timeout period after which the Test System sends another message if the expected confirmation is not received."<SEP>"Timer for the EV to wait for a valid CM_VALIDATE.CNF response before retrying."

NATIONAL TSING HUA UNIVERSITY.description:
National Tsing Hua University, located in Hsinchu City, Taiwan, is a public higher education institution prominently involved in education and research. The university frequently engages with international standards, reflecting its commitment to high academic and research standards, particularly in areas related to electric vehicle (EV) technology and other relevant fields. 

National Tsing Hua University holds a single-user license for the ISO 15118-3:2015 standard document. It is licensed to access, download, and utilize various ISO documents. Specifically, Yi-Shin Chen, associated with the university, is the licensed user mentioned in relation to accessing these documents. The university's engagement with the ISO standards demonstrates its involvement in validation protocols, test case procedures, and the implementation of standards necessary for research and technical evaluation. 

Yi-Shin Chen’s association with the licensing information highlights his role in the university’s activities related to ISO standards. This involvement includes accessing and utilizing ISO documents for specific test cases, validation procedures, and conducting relevant research or educational activities. In summary, National Tsing Hua University’s comprehensive licensing and active research utilizing ISO standards underscore its prominent role in advancing technical and scientific research in Taiwan.

EVSE.description:
EVSE (Electric Vehicle Supply Equipment) is a crucial technology involved in the charging and validation processes for electric vehicles (EVs). It is the hardware and infrastructure responsible for delivering electrical energy to charge EVs, commonly referred to as a charging station. EVSE systems ensure effective energy transfer and compliance with standards such as ISO 15118-3:2015 and IEC 61851-1, making them essential for the interface and interaction with electric vehicles.

The document frequently references EVSE within the context of testing, validation, and charging processes. EVSE is involved in SLAC (Signal Level Attenuation Characterization) testing, which entails signal strength measurements and compliance with local regulations. It is also part of various validation processes mentioned multiple times in the document.

EVSE performs several important functions during the charging process, including managing the charging activities, handling errors, addressing communication losses, and ensuring secure energy transfer. Equipped with a communication module, often employing HomePlug Green PHY signals, EVSE facilitates communication required for the SLAC process, amplitude map (AMP) exchanges, and logical network parameter exchanges with the EVs.

Overall, EVSE is integral to the electric vehicle charging infrastructure, ensuring proper energy delivery, communication, and compliance with standard protocols, thereby supporting the broader ecosystem of electric vehicle transportation.

ISO.description:
The International Organization for Standardization (ISO) is an independent, non-governmental international organization headquartered in Switzerland. ISO serves as a global federation composed of representatives from various national standards organizations. It develops and publishes a wide array of international standards across technical, industrial, and commercial sectors. 

Notably, ISO is responsible for the creation and publication of the ISO 15118 series, which focuses on vehicle-to-grid communication protocols. This series includes important documents such as ISO 15118-3:2015, which provides guidelines for electric vehicle communication and charging system protocols, and ISO 15118-5:2018, which includes specifications and test cases for electric vehicle communication controller (EVCC) and supply equipment communication controller (SECC) functions. These standards are mentioned and referenced in various technical contexts for their relevance to electric vehicles and related infrastructure.

ISO plays a crucial role in ensuring quality, safety, and efficiency by creating, developing, and maintaining global standards. These standards facilitate interoperability and uniformity across different industries worldwide. Additionally, ISO collaborates with other international bodies, such as the International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC), to ensure comprehensive and cohesive standardization across electrotechnical matters.

ISO 15118-5:2018(E) is a standard developed, published, and maintained by ISO, the International Organization for Standardization. This document, which was issued in 2018, outlines the protocols and procedures for electric vehicle communication and testing. Specifically, it details test case descriptions and procedures for PLC Link Status and electric vehicle charging protocols. Serving as an authoritative guideline, ISO 15118-5:2018(E) establishes the standards for conformance testing of electric vehicle communication systems. The standard is widely referenced and used in related documentation and applications. ISO's role in creating, publishing, and maintaining this standard underscores its responsibility in the standard-setting process for electric vehicle communication protocols.

ISO 15118-5:2018 is a standard created and published by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO). This document focuses on compliance testing and sets forth conformance criteria for electric vehicle communication controllers. It defines the communication protocols and testing procedures to be used in the context of electric vehicle charging. ISO is responsible for the development, publication, and maintenance of this standard, ensuring it meets the necessary guidelines and is continually updated. The standard reflects ISO's ongoing commitment to providing comprehensive and reliable standards across various industries.

EV.description: "EV (Electric Vehicle) is referred to in the context of testing processes, such as the SLAC matching and attenuation characterization."<SEP>EV (Electric Vehicle) refers to a vehicle powered by electric motors that uses energy from rechargeable batteries. It interacts with the EVSE (Electric Vehicle Supply Equipment) for tasks such as charging, energy management, signal strength measurement, and communication. The EV is responsible for following validation steps and processes outlined in standards such as ISO 15118-3. It receives HomePlug Green PHY signals from the EVSE to facilitate communication and can detect loss of communication, switching to basic charging mode or stopping charging depending on the EVSE's settings. Additionally, the EV participates in processes like the AMP MAP Exchange and is a central component in the matching and communication processes defined in the document. Overall, EVs are key participants in the network management context, ensuring proper interaction and compliance with the designated standards.

connections.description: "HomePlug Green PHY signals are received by the EV from the EVSE to enable bidirectional communication."

"HLC protocol is used by EV to manage communication with EVSE during sleep mode and wake-up."

"EV utilizes control pilot communication to interact with EVSE, especially during error loss and recovery."<SEP>"The EV uses the control pilot line to communicate signaling information with the EVSE during the matching and validation processes."
"EV uses SLAC as part of its process in determining the suitable EVSE for connection and communication."
"EV receives D-LINK_ERROR.requests from HLE and follows specific protocols for error handling and communication loss."

"ISO 15118-3:2015(E) outlines specific configurations and requirements for the low-layer communication module on the EV side."<SEP>"ISO 15118-3:2015(E) outlines the procedures EVs must follow during communication and error handling with EVSE."
"EV follows the TP_match_leave duration for network separation during error handling."
"EV transitions to B1 state according to the control pilot signalling process during error handling."
"T_conn_resetup is the EV’s parameter for restarting the connection process during error handling."

"BCB-Toggle is a mechanism used to wake up the EV from sleep mode when signaled by the EVSE."<SEP>"EV starts the BCB-Toggle sequence for validation purposes in accordance with the ISO 15118-3 standard."<SEP>"The EV uses the BCB-Toggle sequence to change the control pilot state during the validation process."

"ISO 15118 defines the communication protocol and validation processes that the EV must follow during interactions with the EVSE."
"EV is involved in the testing process where the CM_SLAC_PARM.REQ message is sent and processed."
"EV confirms the receipt of attenuation characterization results by sending CM_ATTEN_CHAR.RSP messages."

"EV sends CM_VALIDATE.REQ messages to EVSE as part of the validation process."<SEP>"EV sends the CM_VALIDATE.REQ message to the EVSE to start the validation process."<SEP>"The EV sends the CM_VALIDATE.REQ as the first step in the validation process."

"EV sends CM_SLAC_MATCH.REQ messages to EVSE to request logical network parameters."<SEP>"The EV sends a CM_SLAC_MATCH.REQ to the EVSE to initiate the matching process."<SEP>"The EV sends the CM_SLAC_MATCH.REQ message to inform the EVSE of its decision during the validation process."
"EV sends M-SOUNDS to help EVSE nodes in calculating signal strengths for matching."

"EV receives CM_VALIDATE.CNF messages from EVSE as confirmation during the validation process."<SEP>"The EV waits for the CM_VALIDATE.CNF during the validation process."
"The EV host compares the Power Spectral Density (PSD) values at the socket to determine necessary power reductions."

"EVCC test cases assess various parameters for CmSlacParm, ensuring accurate signal attenuation characterization."
"EVCC test cases incorporate CmValidate, focusing on validating communication links and data integrity."
"EVCC test cases include assessments for CmAmpMap, focusing on the amplitude mapping protocols."
"EVCC test cases evaluate attenuation characterization, which involves measuring signal attenuation in the communication link."
"EVCC test cases assess CmSlacMatch, ensuring proper signal level attenuation matching."

SECC + PLC BRIDGE FUNCTIONS.description: "The SECC + PLC bridge functions describe the integration of supply equipment communication controller functionalities with power line communication (PLC) bridge operations, essential for ensuring reliable data transfer between electric vehicles and charging infrastructure."

connections.description: "SECC + PLC bridge functions include key setting and verification test cases as part of CmSetKey assessments."
"SECC + PLC bridge functions ensure the correct implementation and validation of CmSlacMatch procedures."

PLCLINKSTATUS.description: "PLCLinkStatus is a crucial event or procedure in the document, involving link status verification and execution of related test cases."<SEP>"PLCLinkStatus is a state or condition in the testing communication protocols related to Power Line Communication links."<SEP>"PLCLinkStatus refers to the event of checking the status of the power line communication link in EVCC functions."<SEP>"PLCLinkStatus refers to the status and health of the power line communication link between the electric vehicle and the charging infrastructure, assessed through a series of test cases specified in ISO 15118-5:2018."<SEP>"PLCLinkStatus refers to the status of the Power Line Communication link, which is vital in the context of ISO 15118-5:2018 for electric vehicle communication standards."<SEP>"PLCLinkStatus refers to the status of the power line communication link with specific test cases."<SEP>"PLClinkStatus refers to the status of the Power Line Communication link, which is checked during the EVCC tests."

connections.description: "EVCC test cases include specific protocols for evaluating PLCLinkStatus, ensuring the communication link's reliability and performance."
"PLCLinkStatus procedures involve attenuation characterization as part of the broader testing context."
"PreCondition includes checking the PLClinkStatus to ensure it meets the necessary requirements for testing."
"HAL_61851_Listener is responsible for monitoring the PLClinkStatus during EVCC testing."
"SECC_Tester monitors and utilizes PLCLinkStatus within its testing framework."
"The EVCC_Tester runs tests to determine the status of PLC links, ensuring proper communication in EV charging."

CMSLACPARM.description: "CmSlacParm appears to be part of the communication protocol parameters referred to during the testing procedures."<SEP>"CmSlacParm involves specific test cases and parameters for verifying the signal level attenuation characterization in the power line communication link between EVCC and SECC."<SEP>"CmSlacParm is a module defining functions related to SLAC (Signal Level Attenuation Characterization) parameter requests in the SECC environment."<SEP>"CmSlacParm is a parameter related to the SLAC process, involved in the PLClink status tests and characterization."<SEP>"CmSlacParm refers to a set of test cases within the SECC and PLC bridge test cases for communication and validation purposes."<SEP>"CmSlacParm refers to parameters used in testing the EVCC-PLC bridge, particularly in the SLAC layer."<SEP>"CmSlacParm refers to smart load and control parameters in the context of ISO 15118-5:2018."<SEP>"CmSlacParm stands for SLAC Parameters used in the test procedures for signal attenuation characterization."

connections.description: "EVCC test cases assess various parameters for CmSlacParm, ensuring accurate signal attenuation characterization."
"SECC is responsible for conducting and validating the CmSlacParm test cases, indicating its role in communication and testing."
"PICS_CMN_CMN_InvalidStatesAndDutyCycles is related to the CmSlacParm procedures, as indicated by their test case interactions."
"CmSlacParm parameters are tested by the EVCC_Tester in the specified test cases."
"EVCC is involved in the testing and communication process for CmSlacParm, a parameter related to SLAC protocols."

CMVALIDATE.description: "CmValidate comprises test cases designed to validate the communication connection and data integrity between the electric vehicle and charging station."<SEP>"CmValidate is a concept related to validation procedures executed as part of module DC_EVCC_SLAC_Control operations."<SEP>"CmValidate is a process or event related to the validation of SECC components and procedures."<SEP>"CmValidate refers to the process and validation state with specific test cases like TC_SECC_CMN_VTB_CmValidate_013."<SEP>"CmValidate refers to the validation process described in the technical configurations multiple times."<SEP>"cmValidate signifies a test procedure event involved in the validation process described in multiple instances throughout the text."

connections.description: "EVCC test cases incorporate CmValidate, focusing on validating communication links and data integrity."
"PIXIT EVCC is involved in the CmValidate process as part of the technical configurations."
"PIXIT_SECC_CMN_CmValidate is specifically assigned the cmValidate procedure code for test validation."
"PIXIT_EVCC_CMN_CmValidate represents a condition affecting how CmValidate is performed."
"The condition PIXIT_EVCC_CMN_FallbackValidationFailed leads to specific actions in CmValidate procedures."
"PIXIT_EVCC_CMN_FallbackValidationNotRequired config influences the validation approach in CmValidate processes."
"PIXIT_EVCC_CMN_ConcurrentValidation ensures concurrent validation efforts during CmValidate procedures."

CMAMPMAP.description: "CmAmpMap appears to be a module or functionality related to the EVCC Tester system's operations."<SEP>"CmAmpMap includes test cases that assess the amplitude mapping protocols within the power line communication framework between EVCC and SECC."<SEP>"CmAmpMap is a parameter that defines the mapping of amplitude within the testing configuration."<SEP>"CmAmpMap refers to the mapping of amplitude characteristics, with specific test cases like TC_SECC_CMN_VTB_CmAmpMap_004 and TC_SECC_CMN_VTB_CmAmpMap_005."<SEP>"CmAmpMap represents another set of procedures and test cases highlighted in the document."<SEP>"CmAmpMap, or Amplitude Map, is a key aspect of the SECC communications, involving the exchange of amplitude mapping information."

connections.description: "EVCC test cases include assessments for CmAmpMap, focusing on the amplitude mapping protocols."

ATTENUATION CHARACTERIZATION.description: "Attenuation Characterization governs the test cases and functions aimed at measuring signal attenuation in the power line communication link used in EVCC and SECC."<SEP>"Attenuation Characterization is a process to evaluate the signal attenuation characteristics within an EVCC system."<SEP>"Attenuation Characterization is a specific precondition test that characterizes signal attenuation for validation purposes."<SEP>"Attenuation Characterization is a test procedure for evaluating signal attenuation in the test cases."<SEP>"Attenuation Characterization refers to the process described in the document, part of a testing sequence to measure and analyze signal attenuation."<SEP>"Attenuation Characterization refers to the process or test for characterizing signal attenuation within the system."<SEP>"Attenuation characterization refers to the process of assessing signal loss or weakening in the SLAC configuration."

connections.description: "SLAC is an integral part of the Attenuation Characterization tests conducted in the system."<SEP>"SLAC protocol undergoes Attenuation Characterization to evaluate signal quality during testing."<SEP>"The SLAC procedure is part of the Attenuation Characterization process in evaluating EVCC systems."
"EVSE_NOT_FOUND is an event resulting from the TT_EV_atten_results timeout during the attenuation characterization process."
"TT_match_response is a specific test outcome in the attenuation characterization process, indicating a failed matching process."
"EVCC test cases evaluate attenuation characterization, which involves measuring signal attenuation in the communication link."
"SECC_Tester conducts the Attenuation Characterization tests within SystemSECC."
"Attenuation Characterization is an essential Pre Condition event for the successful execution of the test behavior."
"EVCC_Tester runs various test cases as part of the Attenuation Characterization process for EVCC systems."
"Attenuation Characterization is a procedure derived and described within the ISO 15118-5:2018(E) standard."
"The CM_SLAC_MATCH.CNF message is part of the attenuation characterization process described in the document."
"CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND messages are part of the signal attenuation tests in the attenuation characterization."
"CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF messages are referenced in the context of attenuation characterization but are ignored."
"CM_ATTEN_PROFILE.IND messages are part of the characterization process but are ignored as stated in the document."
"The function f_SECC_CMN_TB_VTB_AttenuationCharacterization_006 encapsulates the attenuation characterization process."
"a_SECC_processPLCLinkNotifications_001 is part of the broader attenuation characterization handling PLC link notifications."

CMSLACMATCH.description: "CmSlacMatch encompasses test cases for matching the signal level attenuation characteristics of the power line communication link."<SEP>"CmSlacMatch is a set of test cases executed in a validation process specified within the document."<SEP>"CmSlacMatch is referenced as part of the SECC functions related to the ISO 15118-5:2018 standard."<SEP>"CmSlacMatch refers to a series of procedures and test cases executed within the document."<SEP>"CmSlacMatch refers to the matching procedure concept utilized within the test cases of the module operations."

PICS.description: "PICS (Protocol Implementation Conformance Statement) is a part of the ISO 15118 test suite related to protocol implementation capability."<SEP>"PICS refers to data types defined for physical and data link layer conformance tests as part of ISO 15118-5:2018(E)"<SEP>"Protocol Implementation Conformance Statement, involved in selecting parameters for testing and communication protocols."<SEP>"Protocol Implementation Conformance Statement, which outlines the protocols a system must adhere to in order to be compliant."

connections.description: "PICS and PIXIT are both components of protocol implementation that ensure a system meets conformance and testing criteria."<SEP>"PICS and PIXIT work together in the selection of parameters for protocol testing."

PIXIT.description: "PIXIT (Protocol Implementation Extra Information for Testing) is a set of requirements necessary for testing and validation processes mentioned throughout the document."<SEP>"PIXIT (Protocol Implementation eXtra Information for Testing) is necessary for testing various requirements explicitly in SECC/EVCC black box configuration."<SEP>"PIXIT (Protocol Implementation eXtra Information for Testing) refers to the additional information required to test certain requirements in the document."<SEP>"PIXIT (Protocol Implementation eXtra Information for Testing) refers to the specific implementation details used during the test scenarios."<SEP>"PIXIT (Protocol Implementation extra Information for Testing) is another part of the ISO 15118 test suite related to protocol implementation capability."<SEP>"PIXIT refers to a testing artifact used in conjunction with requirements in the ISO standards document."<SEP>"PIXIT refers to data types defined for interoperability tests that involve actual application logic as part of ISO 15118-5:2018(E)."<SEP>"PIXIT stands for Protocol Implementation Extra Information for Testing, which refers to additional information used to define the testing details related to specific profiles in the context of ISO 15118-3."<SEP>"PIXIT stands for Protocol Implementation eXtra Information for Testing, which provides detailed implementation-specific information required for standard conformity testing."<SEP>"PIXIT, or Protocol Implementation eXtra Information for Testing, is a part of the test configuration necessary for evaluating requirements in the document."<SEP>"Protocol Implementation eXtra Information for Testing, associated with specific selections for testing communication protocols."<SEP>"Protocol Implementation extra Information for Testing, which provides additional information required for testing the implementations."

TT_MATCH_RESPONSE TIMER.description: "A timer in the testing procedure used to confirm no CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF message is sent by the SUT until it expires."<SEP>"A timer mechanism referenced in the test procedures to validate the response time of communication between the electric vehicle (EV) and the electric vehicle supply equipment (EVSE)."<SEP>"TT_match_response timer is a concept involving a timer that must expire before a CM_VALIDATE.CNF message can be sent by the SUT under certain conditions."<SEP>"TT_match_response timer is a timer in the test system that checks the response time after a CM_SLAC_MATCH.REQ message is sent."<SEP>"TT_match_response timer is a timer mechanism used to check the expiration of response time during certain test procedures."<SEP>"TT_match_response timer is a timer that expires before the CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF message is expected from the SUT."<SEP>"TT_match_response timer is a timing event used in the testing process to ensure appropriate response intervals."<SEP>"TT_match_response timer is a timing mechanism mentioned in the document that is used during the testing procedure."<SEP>"TT_match_response timer is a timing mechanism used in the test procedures to determine when confirmation messages should be sent."<SEP>"TT_match_response timer is an event that marks the duration after which certain actions are checked during tests."<SEP>"TT_match_response timer is another specific timer that governs the response validation timeline for the SUT."<SEP>"TT_match_response timer is another timer referenced in the test procedure for TC_SECC_CMN_VTB_CmSlacParm_004."<SEP>"TT_match_response timer is used during the SLAC validation process to check the timing of responses to messages."<SEP>"The TT_match_response timer is an event referenced in the document, indicating a timing mechanism within the test procedures."

connections.description: "In test case TC_SECC_CMN_VTB_CmSlacParm_004, the Test System checks that no CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF message is sent until the TT_match_response timer has expired."<SEP>"The CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF message is expected after the TT_match_response timer expires."
"The TT_match_response timer ensures that no CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF message is sent by the SUT until it expires."

"The TT_match_response timer is used by the Test System to check response expirations during testing."<SEP>"The Test System uses the TT_match_response timer to determine when to check for messages during tests."<SEP>"The Test System uses the TT_match_response timer to measure response times in the tests."
"The TT_match_response timer ensures that no response message is sent by the SUT until the timer expires after a CM_SLAC_MATCH.REQ message is sent."

It includes parameters such as runID, EV MAC, EVSE MAC, and additional valid parameters necessary for testing."

"CM_SLAC_MATCH.CNF message confirms the successful validation of the parameters sent by the CM_SLAC_MATCH.REQ message."

"The CM_SLAC_MATCH.REQ message also includes the EVSE MAC address as part of its required parameters.

SLAC VALIDATION PROCESS.description: "SLAC (Signal Level Attenuation Characterization) validation process ensures the quality and reliability of communication signals between electric vehicles and charging stations."<SEP>"SLAC Validation Process refers to the validation steps and criteria involved in the context of the text."<SEP>"SLAC validation process is a method used to validate the communication and charge authorization between electric vehicles and charging stations."<SEP>"SLAC validation process is a procedure to validate electric vehicle supply equipment in the document."<SEP>"SLAC validation process is a sequential test protocol to ensure standard compliance, especially for validating communication systems."<SEP>"SLAC validation process is a step included in some procedures during the testing of SLAC-related functions."<SEP>"SLAC validation process refers to a system procedure that is mentioned in various test cases within the document for validating certain communication parameters."<SEP>"SLAC validation process refers to the Secure Link-Active Coordination process used for validating parameters during the test procedures."<SEP>"The SLAC validation process involves verifying specific components of the electric vehicle system."<SEP>"The SLAC validation process refers to the method used to validate the communication between electric vehicles (EVs) and electric vehicle supply equipment (EVSE) in the context of ISO 15118 standards."

EVCC.description:
The Electric Vehicle Communication Controller (EVCC) is a significant component in the realm of electric vehicle charging communication protocols and testing scenarios. EVCC plays a crucial role in managing communication between electric vehicles (EV) and electric vehicle supply equipment (EVSE). It is frequently mentioned within the context of ISO test cases, particularly those related to ISO 15118 standards, as well as other standards such as IEC 61851-1.

EVCC's responsibilities encompass handling communication protocols, ensuring proper state changes, and monitoring during the charging process. It is involved in various testing requirements and validations, including internal state and timing tests, black box test configurations, and the Attenuation Characterization process for communication message management. Moreover, the EVCC interacts with the Supply Equipment Communication Controller (SECC) to validate requirements and execute several test functions.

This component is integral to the testing and implementation of communication standards, contributing to the compliance and proper functioning of electric vehicle charging systems. Frequently termed as the system under test (SUT), the EVCC is pivotal for managing the communication between the EV and the charging infrastructure, ensuring reliable and efficient energy transfer during charging.

"IEC 61851-1 includes specific testing and protocol observance requirements for EVCC (Electric Vehicle Communication Controller)."
"The EVCC participates in the SLAC processes, working together with SECC."

"PLC technology is also utilized by EVCC for efficient communication protocols in EVSE."
"The EVCC control parts and various test cases are specified within the ISO document, indicating standardization efforts by ISO."
"Yi-Shin Chen has access to EVCC templates through the licensing agreement with National Tsing Hua University."

"EVCC is highlighted in the ISO 15118-5 document through its involvement in multiple test case scenarios."<SEP>"ISO 15118-5 outlines the conformance tests and configurations involving the EVCC as one of the main entities."
